SENT.plain: Therapy-related myelodysplastic syndrome (t-MDS) and acute nonlymphocytic leukemia (t-ANLL) are dramatic complications of cancer chemotherapy
Drugs like plant alkaloids or antimetabolites have not been reported to cause either t-MDS or t-ANLL
Monosomy 7(-7) and trisomy 8(+8) are among the most common abnormalities in myelodysplastic syndromes
Both abnormalities in two different clones of the same patient are very rarely reported
Such a myelodysplastic syndrome occurring shortly after treatment with an antimetabolite, the adenosine analogue cladribine (1-chlorodeoxadenosine), and involved field radiotherapy is reported here
